Test¶

class lingpy.algorithm.classes.WordList(data, meta=None, conf='')¶

Basic class for the handling of multilingual word lists.

Parameters :

data : dict

A dictionary with consecutive integers as keys and lists as values.

meta : dict

A simple dictionary of key-value pairs storing some metadata of the original dataset.

conf : string (default=None)

A string defining the path to the configuration file.

Notes

A word list is created from a data-dictionary and a meta-dictionary. The first contains the main data (keys and lists of values, corresponding to a column specified by key with id 0), and the latter contains additional data which was read in when parsing a qlc-formatted input file. If meta or conf are left undefined, the default values will be used.

conf is the path to the configuration file. this file consists of 3 columns, the first column is the internal name which is reserved for a column in the input data, the second column defines the datatype, and the third column defines aliases, separated by a comma

When creating a wl instance, a specific data-structure is created consisting of * self._data : the original data * self._dict : a dictionary representation of columns and cells * self._array : a flat representation of the data as an array * self._idx : an index which is needed to get the data of the array

Methods

add
getDict
getList
